trial_identification.studytitle: Aerobic Fitness, Strength and Quality of Life in Children with Haemophilia
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of an exercise intervention on quality of life, aerobic fitness and strength in children with haemophilia

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other human genetics and inherited disorders

interventions.interventions: This study will be a clinical trial of exercise for children with haemophilia. The treatment group will receive a general exercise program (aerobic exercise and resistance training) lasting 12 weeks. The effects of the control and exercise treatments will be measured at the beginning and end of the exercise program.
interventions.comparator: In this study the control group will receive usual care.

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: These will be elicited by open-ended questioning during the intervention.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: To participate in the study children must fulfill the following inclusion criteria: - Diagnosis of mild, moderate or severe haemophilia (A or B) or Von Willebrands disease- Patient/guardian and child agrees to accept randomisation to either intervention or control group.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: They have Factor VIII antibodies- They live outside the Sydney metropolitan region and therefore cannot attend for intervention- Any contraindication to aerobic or resistance training- They are involved in organised physical activity for more than 3 sessions (>1 hour) per week.
